et: Middle English {it}rasen{/it} "to scrape, shave, erase, expunge, strip off, tear out, pull down, slice, score, tear," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}raser, rasser{/it} "to erase, level (a measure of grain) by scraping off, fill to the brim" (Continental Old French also, "to shave, tear down, demolish"), going back to Vulgar Latin {it}*rāsāre{/it}, iterative verb from the stem of Latin {it}rādere{/it} "to scrape, scratch, pare away, shave, rub smooth, touch lightly in passing," going back to a dialectal Indo-European verb base {it}*razd-{/it}, whence also Welsh {it}rhathu{/it} "to rub, scrape, file down," Breton {it}razhañ{/it}
